setup.question: What was the blue spectral vehicle Dan acquired?

Text.text: This story is about a man who is curious about a series of crimes where art vanishes from vaults, so he stakes out in the vault of an artist who has not yet been robbed, and discovers that time travelers are responsible for the heists. <<2360-2398> The machine is a cage, yes:
but the key is that it allows one to travel through time

Dan Slane gets a job guarding a painting inside a vault because he wanted to investigate mysterious disappearances of paintings across the country. One day, a couple of thieves appear in front of him inside the vault
. He holds them up at gunpoint and gets inside the cage and sees
and then looks for additional controls inside the cage. He ends up using the cage, not really knowing what he's doing, however when he arrives he sees
, who reveals itself to be
, revealing his machine to be an inter-dimensional travel cage

A- it seems ur quote didn't appear include the quote that wasn't included
B- I am leaning  toward B because the main character literally meets someone described as an inter-dimensional agent
The first machine is a time machine, and then there is a desire to create a new machine, where the InterDimensional agent is introduced, you'll notice those quotes are after these.

There is no "desire to create a new machine" as the first machine itself is described as the cage, see (1225-1228). A is just straight up lying to you.

Additionally, this is what Dan /thinks/ the machine is before he actually steps inside it. His first reaction is that it's a time machine, but then he actually goes INSIDE the machine and
. He even tries to find the controls for time thinking it's a time machine but he can't find it:
(see quotes pane for continuation).

B-What made Dan realize it was an Inter-dimensional cage? 
A you conceded it was a cage which makes me lean B.
A- show evidence there is a desire to create a new machine. why would he make a new machine....he's a security officer

Dan realizes this when he starts playing with the controls to try to get out of the vault he's stuck in. There are /multiple/ levers, and they move the cage (with Dan in it) in different dimensions, forward, backward, etc:
I don't even know what the quote A provided is even referring to in the context of your question, safe to say they've given up
A expand on the quote don't give up. Dan acquired a blue spectral vehicle. Is that the vehicle?
the quote is pretty obvious, he makes a new machine for money.
"Supply" the machine doesn't mean that Dan is creating a new machine, he's just giving his current vehicle to Blote. Blote is referring to the cage that Dan has,
says

This is all referring to him taking the cage and then running from the vault he was originally stationed in. The deal Blote offers him is to exchange the cage so that Dan doesn't have stolen property on him.
A you've given up it seems which leaves me to vote for B.
A has more quotes and their quotes are from the end of the story and clearly talk about a time machine.

answers.reason for outcome: there wasn't much ev to prove A

answers.other: I thought I was the dishonest debater in this round
answers.reason for outcome: Debater A just kind of gave up
I got the right answer because A gave up. B had clear strong evidence. A conceded that the vehicle was called a cage.
